FuncDef:
The vrrp recover-delay command sets a status recovery delay for all VRRP backup groups.
The undo vrrp recover-delay command restores the default value.
By default, the status recovery delay is 0 seconds, indicating that VRRP backup group flapping is not suppressed.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a status recovery delay for all VRRP backup groups.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 3600, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the status of the interface on which a VRRP backup group resides frequently changes, the VRRP backup group frequently flaps. To prevent this situation, run the vrrp recover-delay command to set a status recovery delay to suppress VRRP backup group flapping.
Prerequisites
After a status recovery delay is set for a VRRP backup group, the VRRP backup group responds to a received interface Up event only after the configured status recovery delay elapses, which prevents interface flapping from causing VRRP backup group flapping.
Precautions
If the vrrp recover-delay command is run in the system view on a device, the same status recovery delay is set for all VRRP backup groups on the device.
